descriptions: Student cannot identify any trusted adults in their family, school, or community for advice on healthy eating and physical activity.
Student identifies one or two adults, but their roles are not clearly defined or relevant to health advice.
Student identifies some adults in their family, school or community, but their explanations are vague regarding how these adults can provide advice related to healthy eating and physical activity.
Student identifies multiple adults and provides a basic explanation of how they can offer advice on healthy eating or physical activity.
Student clearly identifies multiple trusted adults in various settings (family, school, community) and explains their potential roles in providing health-related advice and support.

Student comprehensively identifies multiple trusted adults, detailing their specific expertise and how they can provide advice and counseling on both healthy eating and physical activity with insightful reasoning.
Chosen adults demonstrate no relevance or expertise in providing health advice.
Some chosen adults have questionable relevance to health-related advice.
Most adults chosen might have some relevance to health, but it's tenuous.
Adults chosen generally can provide health advice.
Adults chosen are highly relevant and can provide health advice.
Adults chosen are all extremely relevant and are excellent choices for providing health advice.
